intro: Strychnos innocua subsp. dysophylla, commonly known as the dwarf arrowroot, is a small shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are a key feature in its botanical classification. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in shaded environments. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
